TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StyleDefinitionTitle extends DocumentFormat.OpenXml.OpenXmlLeafElement

summary.para: When the object is serialized out as xml, its qualified name is dgm:title.

remarks.format: ## Remarks [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlnoticeiso.md)] **title (Title)** This element defines the title given to a style definition header. The title is simply a name for the style definition. [*Example*: Consider the following example of title being used in DiagramML: ```xml <desc val="My Description"/> … </styleDefHdr> ``` In this example we see the title being set to *My Title*. *end example*] |Parent Elements| |---------------------| |styleDef (§21.4.5.7); styleDefHdr (§21.4.5.8)| |Attributes|Description| |----------------|-----------------| |lang (Natural Language)|The natural language of the title or description of this quick style.<br /><br /> The possible values for this attribute are defined by the W3C XML Schema *string* datatype.| |val (Description Value)|The string used for the description.<br /><br /> The possible values for this attribute are defined by the W3C XML Schema *string* datatype.| [*Note*: The W3C XML Schema definition of this element’s content model (CT_SDName) is located in §A.5.3. *end note*] [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlcopyrightiso.md)]

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Language : DocumentFormat.OpenXml.StringValue with get, set

summary.para: Represents the following attribute in the schema: lang

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following information from the ECMA International [Standard ECMA-376](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-376.htm) can be useful when working with this class.
The natural language of the title or description of this quick style.
The possible values for this attribute are defined by the XML Schema `string` data type.
